error_codes.1: Incorrect function. This could happen if a function is called on a COM port that does not support it.
error_codes.2: File Not Found (The specified COM port could not be found or is disabled.)
error_codes.5: Access Denied (The COM port is in use by another application.)
error_codes.6: The handle is invalid. This might happen if thereâ€™s a problem with how the port was opened or managed.
error_codes.10: The environment is incorrect. This might indicate an issue with the configuration of the COM port.
error_codes.20: The system cannot find the device specified. Similar to ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND, it might indicate that the COM port is missing.
error_codes.21: The device is not ready. This might occur if the COM port device is not ready to receive data.
error_codes.22: The device does not recognize the command given to it. This could indicate that the command or data sent to the COM port is not valid.
error_codes.24: The length of the data provided to a system call is invalid.
error_codes.31: A device attached to the system is not functioning. This could indicate hardware issues with the port.
error_codes.87: The parameter is incorrect. This might occur if the port is being accessed with incorrect settings or configurations.
error_codes.110: The system cannot open the device or file specified.
error_codes.121: The semaphore timeout period has expired. This might occur if the device connected to the port is not responding.
error_codes.122: The data area passed to a system call is too small.
error_codes.234: More data is available. This might occur if a buffer is too small to hold the data being received.
error_codes.995: The I/O operation has been aborted due to thread exit or application request.
error_codes.998: Invalid access to memory location. This might happen if the memory associated with the COM port is not accessible.
error_codes.1117: The request could not be performed because of an I/O device error. This indicates a general problem with the hardware.
error_codes.1167: The device is not connected. This usually occurs when the device was physically disconnected or powered off.
error_codes.1460: This operation returned because the timeout period expired.
